summary:
Shinichi Noguchi, as a founder and CEO of BOSCA Co.,Ltd., mainly supports the management and business development of local ventures and has been involved in the start-up of numerous social entrepreneurs and local government policy-making. He moved to the Netherlands in July 2022, where he started a project with Japanese entrepreneurs and small and medium-sized companies to revigoratealise Japanese local regions through Regenerative initiatives, using his European networks and knowledge in the SDGs and Circular Economy.

Extensive experience and competence of management at executive level (including internationally diverse teams/corporation) and non-profit organisations are Shinichi’s key skills deprived from learning at Trinity College Dublin and the experience of leading international business development projects. In addition to his experience in founding companies in Malaysia, he has also served as a board member of a venture companies he founded with social entrepreneurs and as a policy advisor to the government. He has also participated in overseas expansion projects, mainly for Japanese companies, and has several professional experiences in overseas business development. Currently, Shinichi is also the director and COO of Kitasanriku Factory, a regenerative seafood venture in the town of Hirono, Iwate Prefecture, a senior strategic advisor to Fukuyama City, Hamamatsu City and other governments, and the representative director of Smart Work Lab, a specified non-profit organisation.

Shinichi received a Master in Business Administrative (MBA) from Trinity College Dublin, Ireland. He graduated with honors from the University of Tokyo, Japan.


Key Skills and Abilities
・	Experienced in Business Management, Corporate Strategy and Planning, Business Development and Partnership Relationship
・	Experienced in an international diverse team/project management.
・	Strong communication skills to manage and facilitate projects both in Japanese and English.
・	Remarkable presentation skills.
・	Problem solving and analyzing skills with a proactive approach.
・	Technology literate- experience of Word, Excel and PowerPoint as well as SPSS.
・	Conversant with basic principles of government and social business as well as movie production, web design and web system integration.

projects.title: Scaling Project - airmid healthgroup
projects.description: The scaling project is a business-consulting project that challenges MBA students to deliver a value adding solution to client companies in a restricted period of two weeks.  The team analyzed three key areas of airmid, which included an organisational, marketing and competitor analysis.  Based on this analysis, the team identified airmid’s key opportunities and produced recommendations for its marketing strategy.  The deliverables for this project included a presentation to airmid and a written report.

profile_positions.description:
- Consultancy for Local Small and Medium Sized Social Enterprise: Managing international projects partnering with local ventures and entrepreneurs to develop businesses and manage the corporation, more importantly, to provide economic reinvigoration of local cities in rural areas of Japan.
- Food and Farming Business Development & Operations: Developing the business of Japanese food e-commerce services and urban farming in Japan, which includes Japanese food subscription service.
profile_positions.title: Founder and Chief Executive Officer

profile_positions.description: - Joining in a branding project for regional products developed by Hironoya Co., Ltd., which operates a fishery processing industry in Hirono Town, located in the northeastern part of Iwate Prefecture, and established Kita-Sanriku Factory Inc. as one of founders on October 1, 2018, a regional trading company that develops and sells products that utilizes local ingredients, centered on Kitamurasaki Uni (sea urchin). Currently manages corporate strategies of the company as COO.
profile_positions.title: Board Member and Chief Operating Officer

profile_positions.description: - Selected from more than 400 applicants, as a senior strategic advisor, mainly involved in policy planning and projects related to the city's population decrease and branding.

profile_positions.description: - Established a specified non-profit organization (NPO) with local business executives to revitalize the city and to create innovation opportunities through the promotion of by attracting external business professionals to Fukuyama City and the Setouchi area. It improves the attractiveness of the city in cooperation with the policies of Fukuyama City.

In addition to planning and developing services, mainly responsible for coordinating and making proposals with external parties.
profile_positions.title: Board Member and Chief Communication Officer

profile_positions.description: - As a strategic business producer, mainly involved in policy planning and projects related to business development in the hilly and mountainous area of the northern part of Hamamatsu City.

profile_positions.description: - With the merger and acquisition of the group companies of IMAGICA Corp. in October 2018 and the change of company name, managing a project named the century project as a project manager building a management philosophy and redesigning the business domain and strategy, aiming for 100-year business growth.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
- Overseeing the movie, commercial, animation, and archiving businesses, and responsible for business visions, strategies, and executing business profits and losses. 
- Driving transformation and growth as head of more than 250 staff members, achieved the V-shaped recovery in one year, although it posted a large deficit in FY2015, by restoring the motivation of the stagnant organization, changing an organization and its culture that does not give up the challenge for growth based on failure.
profile_positions.title: Director of Motion Picture & TV Commercial Dept.

profile_positions.description:
- IMAGICA's first full-scale overseas post-production base was established as a joint venture with the local state-owned fund Khazanah Nasional. In charge of business management as CEO at the time of its incorporation.
* The CEO retired as of the end of June 2015.

profile_positions.description:
- As the key staff of the president, being in charge of planning of business strategy and business development.
- In addition to being involved in a new medium-term management vision, leading the transformation of the organization by promoting the renewal of corporate culture and the development of new businesses in growth fields through the bold selection of young employees.
- In February 2014, the company established its first overseas base in Malaysia and participated in its management. Imagica South East Asia Sdn Bhd / Imagica Inaternational Asia Sdn. Bhd. as Director and CEO until the end of June 2018.
profile_positions.title: Head of Strategic Business Development

profile_positions.description:
* April 2011-September 2012 Leave of absence due to MBA study abroad

As a management planning staff, overseeing management analysis for the purpose of improving the profitability of the entire company and improving operations, communicating and negotiating with each executive officer and coordinating between departments.Appointed in 2010 as the leader of a company-wide structural reform project aimed at improving the profit structure to recover the business that had been depressed due to the Lehman shock. Through discussions and coordination with executive officers across several business divisions, it achieved in reforming strategies that will lead to future growth. At the implementation stage, working to resolve operational issues and recover the operating income margin to 8% in the first year of implementation from the previous year when operating income was in the red.
After returning from MBA study abroad in October 2012, engaged in the planning of corporate vision and new business strategy under the new president who took office in the same year as a key leader in strategic restructuring.
profile_positions.title: Corporate Strategic Planning - Corporate Planning Group, Corporate Planning Department,

profile_positions.description:
- Responsible for marketing and designing new services in the network field.  
- Participated in the planning and production project of Microsoft's Windows Vista campaign site and Office 2007 total promotion site, aiming to enter the sales promotion field in digital media. It leads to the establishment of a new department for aggressive orders.　
- As a project leader, achieved the world's first multi-distribution of highlight video to mobile / PC video sites at the 2006 FIFA World Cup Germany. The solution constructed in this project will be the standard for sports highlight video distribution.
profile_positions.title: Marketing and Business development

profile_positions.description:

profile_positions.title: Producer, P.I.C.S., TOKYO, JAPAN

profile_positions.description:

- From the first year of joining the company, gained record sales from a major TVCM production Aoi Pro., which is one of the most important business partners, then sales increased by 20% year-on-year in the first year.
profile_positions.title: Sales, CM Sales Department
